definition: to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: The black plastic will help seal and the weight of the door holds it down.
sentences.chinese: 黑色塑料膜的作用是密封，而門的重量會把它壓住。

sentences.english: The man was pinned down by a fallen tree.
sentences.chinese: 那人被一棵倒下的樹壓住了。

sentences.english: As you inhale, press in with your thumbs and bring your hips forward.
sentences.chinese: 當你吸氣時，用拇指壓住然後把你的腰往前傾。

sentences.english: But the sound of the clock stifled our hearts' beating.
sentences.chinese: 但鐘的聲音壓住了我們的心跳聲。

sentences.english: And the ether presses your nose and mouth, hard. Then nothing, less than nothing.
sentences.chinese: 乙醚重重的壓住了你的鼻子和嘴。

sentences.english: The cook masked the taste of the bad meat with onions.
sentences.chinese: 廚師用洋蔥壓住臭肉的味道。

sentences.english: Many people could contain the anger of killing somebody as soon as they bethink of the hot seat.
sentences.chinese: 許多人一想到電椅就壓住了想殺人的怒火。

sentences.english: His shirt was still wet from where the pack had rested.
sentences.chinese: 他襯衫上原先被揹包壓住的地方還是汗溼的。

sentences.english: Thr riot was instantly put down by the army.
sentences.chinese: 那暴動迅速被軍隊鎮壓住了。

sentences.english: I want to know why Pellegrin suppressed Tessa's report.
sentences.chinese: 我想知道爲什麼佩格林壓住了塔薩的報告。

sentences.english: If the steam needs quick deflating, the deflation valve stem can be pressed to deflate the steam thoroughly.
sentences.chinese: 如急於放氣可壓住放氣閥杆把蒸汽放淨。

definition: to fiddle with/to tamper with/to meddle with/to move randomly/to flail about
lit. to bite the teeth tightly (idiom); fig. to grit one's teeth and bear the pain/to bite the bullet
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
to aim at/to target/to point at/to be directed at/registration/alignment (mechanical engineering)
